module.title: verbs
module.p: Verbs are words which typically refer to intangible situations – events, states, activities, processes, changes of state &c.
Verbs can be divided into three morphological classes –

ul.li: Derived verbs are understood as having been formed from adjectives or nouns, typically by addition of a suffix eg. gealaich whiten, cuimhnich remember.
Compound verbs are understood as having been formed from other verbs, typically by addition of a prefix eg. ath-sgrìobh rewrite, craobh-sgaoil broadcast.
Simple verbs are not understood as having been formed from other words eg. ith eat, seinn sing.
